Description: The temptation of St Antony. The saint seated on a mound at right, holding a cross in his left hand and facing the two devilish figures at left Etching
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (8.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
